title: CozzaGezza
author: CozzaGezza
content: I've been using an excel spreadsheet for years and I've finally decided to use a tracker app. I've heard coinstats and coinmarketcap are good. I've also heard there is a new platform launching soon called unlockstats. What would people recommend?

comments.author: o48o
comments.body: Delta Investment Tracker. Hands down. I've used many crypto portfolio apps and this was the first one that had everything i had. I should get paid as i am constantly promoting them to my friends and everyone but the gui is sleek, it has real time crypto / exchanges wallet tracking to stocks and it even upgraded to NFTs which suits me just fine now that i am flipping those. I don't even know what other free app would have more features. But i would definitely like to know.Only negative side of it is constant watching of the portfolio. That can be unhealthy as you wouldn't need to react to price movements so fast when you are hodling. But when you are looking a way to report your taxes, having every wallet automatic transaction history in one place is pretty handy.

comments.author: lobo13hf
comments.body: many just settles with CMC and the rest are just what's available in the app store, I think it doesn't matter that much since many are deriving their data from similar sources anyway, therefore the value of the coin shown gonna be the same.

comments.author: makishart
comments.body: Quote from: CozzaGezza on April 03, 2023, 10:05:57 PMI've been using an excel spreadsheet for years and I've finally decided to use a tracker app. I've heard coinstats and coinmarketcap are good. comments.author: shinratensei_
comments.body: It's always great to use tracker app since they're really made for it, but honestly even excel have the capability of connecting to some of the API which means you could easily make the same feature that's available in most of the tracker apps you just need some advanced knowledge though and it definitely might take some of your time setting things up and it's quite complicated honestly, but I'd say coinmarketcap is sufficient enough, since considering they've got best information, but there are some other apps that might be capable of connecting directly to your exchange accounts so that you could observe it real time and there's no need to update the data manually. usually the biggest problem is that, it just feels so inconvenient updating all the data manually and usually we just get tired from it and eventually just dont care.

I just switched to coin tracker, I think this is a good tracker because for me right now compared to coingecko and coinmarketcap.

comments.author: livingfree
comments.body: You've been suggested with free trackers OP and you can choose any of them based on your preference but if you also have a Ledger Wallet, whether it's S or X.It's got the desktop and mobile app which is called Ledger Live. The desktop app supports all three, mac, windows and Linux. https://www.ledger.com/ledger-live

comments.author: babygun
comments.body: Similar like some others, I use the Delta app and happy about it. Easy in use, you can add several portfolios and it is easy to see how much profit or loss you have made. Used excel before also (also for stocks) but these apps are a lot easier in use.

comments.author: Supianto
comments.body: Never used one. I don't want to copy someone's portfolio. I might be not the smartest, but I'll take a full responsibility for it at least.

comments.author: daenarys_stormborn
comments.body: I use blockfolio and coinmarketcap to manage and monitor my portfolio, for beginners I highly recommend coinmarketcap, because I think coinmarketcap has a simpler and easier to understand interface

comments.author: Xal0lex
comments.body: Excel spreadsheet? This is the past century, there are a huge number of services on the market, where you can conveniently track your portfolio of altcoins. You can use cryptocurrency market monitoring services like cryptorank, coingecko, coinmarketcap, etc. Or you can use specialized services for portfolio tracking, like Koinly, CoinTracker, etc. There are a lot of such services on the market and therefore you can always choose a service for any tasks or needs.

comments.author: merekamo
comments.body: Between CoinStats and CoinMarketCap, I would lean more towards CoinStats for its comprehensive portfolio tracking features, user-friendly interface, and the ability to sync with various exchanges and wallets. It seems to be more focused on providing a seamless experience for managing and tracking your cryptocurrency investments.But, for CoinMarketCap as a supplementary resource for market data and insights, as it is widely recognized for its accuracy and reliability in this aspect. If portfolio tracking and management are your top priorities, CoinStats is likely the better option. If you prioritize market data and insights, then CoinMarketCap may be more suitable.
